column2: [C] a person who makes money by starting or running businesses, esp. when this involves taking financial risks 企业家
column3: e.g. He would not have succeeded in such a risky business if he had not been such a clever [[entrepreneur]].

column2: wrong in one's opinion or judgment 意见（或判断）错误的，弄错的
column3: e.g. She wondered whether she'd been [[mistaken]] about his intentions.

column2: wrongly or by mistake 错误地；曲解地；被误解地
column3: e.g. This app will help you get a photo or document back if you [[mistakenly]] delete it.

column2: [C] 虫洞（宇宙中可能存在的连接遥远空间的通道）
1) if buildings sprawl, they spread out over a wide area in an untidy and unattractive way （建筑群）杂乱地延伸（扩展）
column3: e.g. The town [[sprawls]] along the side of the lake.；e.g. He was [[sprawling]] on the sofa watching his favorite TV program.

column2: 2) lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way （懒洋洋地或漫不经心地）摊开手脚躺（坐）着
column3: e.g. The town [[sprawls]] along the side of the lake.；e.g. He was [[sprawling]] on the sofa watching his favorite TV program.

column2: walk slowly across or around an area, usu. without a clear direction or purpose 徘徊；闲逛；漫步于
column3: e.g. She was [[wandering]] aimlessly up and down the road.

column2: [C] a table or small shop with an open front that people sell things from, esp. at a market （尤指集市上的）货摊，摊位，售货亭
column3: e.g. The street is lined with [[stalls]] selling Chinese New Year decorations.

column2: [C] (pl. spectra) a complete range of opinions, people, situations, etc., going from one extreme to its opposite （观点、人、情况等的）范围，幅度
column3: e.g. A balanced diet should contain a broad [[spectrum]] of plant and animal foods.

column2: 1) an electrical wire or wires with a protective covering, usu. for connecting electrical equipment to the supply of electricity 电线
column3: e.g. We used so many lights that we needed four extension [[cords]].；e.g. Have you got some [[cord]] that I can tie this parcel up with?

column2: 2) a piece of thick string or thin rope 粗线；细绳；索；带
column3: e.g. We used so many lights that we needed four extension [[cords]].；e.g. Have you got some [[cord]] that I can tie this parcel up with?

column2: put all the parts of sth. together 组装；装配
column3: e.g. The shelves are sold in kits that you have to [[assemble]] yourself.；e.g. Since she took over the department, she has [[assembled]] a talented team with a varied selection of skills.

column2: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose 集合；聚集
column3: e.g. The shelves are sold in kits that you have to [[assemble]] yourself.；e.g. Since she took over the department, she has [[assembled]] a talented team with a varied selection of skills.

column2: 1) (literary) among or surrounded by things 在···之中；被···所环绕
column3: e.g. We camped in a shallow valley [[amid]] low hills covered with green pine trees.；e.g. The dollar has fallen in value [[amid]] rumors of weakness in the US economy.

column2: 2) while noisy, busy, or confused events are happening — used in writing or news reports 在（嘈杂、纷乱的事件）中（用于书面语或新闻报道中）
column3: e.g. We camped in a shallow valley [[amid]] low hills covered with green pine trees.；e.g. The dollar has fallen in value [[amid]] rumors of weakness in the US economy.

column2: shine brightly with flashing points of light 闪烁；闪光
column3: e.g. Smoothed flat by generations of wind and rain, the stone [[glitters]] in the sun.

column2: (usu. before noun) giving off many small flashes of light 闪光的；闪耀的
column3: e.g. The day ended with a cruise on the Huangpu River where we saw the [[glittering]] skyline of Shanghai.

column2: [C] a person or organization who resists sth. or refuses to accept an offer 抵制者（或组织）；不合作者（或组织）
column3: e.g. A few [[holdouts]] still use typewriters, but nearly everybody uses computers now.

column2: 1) make a copy of; imitate 复制；模仿
column3: e.g. Entrepreneurs have to move faster than ever to ensure others don't [[clone]] their ideas.；e.g. A team from the UK were the first to successfully [[clone]] an animal.

column2: 2) make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially 克隆
column3: e.g. Entrepreneurs have to move faster than ever to ensure others don't [[clone]] their ideas.；e.g. A team from the UK were the first to successfully [[clone]] an animal.

column2: 1) [U] the introduction of new ideas or methods 革新；创新
column3: e.g. We must encourage [[innovation]] if the company is to remain competitive.；e.g. She believed she had come up with one of the greatest [[innovations]] of modern times.

column2: 2) [C] a new idea, method, or invention 新观念；新方法；新发明
column3: e.g. We must encourage [[innovation]] if the company is to remain competitive.；e.g. She believed she had come up with one of the greatest [[innovations]] of modern times.

column2: exist at the same time or in the same place 共存；共处
column3: e.g. Different traditions [[coexist]] successfully in this country.

column2: more and more all the time 不断增加地；越来越多地
column3: e.g. [[Increasingly]], businesses are having to reduce their costs in order to survive.

column2: 1) completely ready to do sth. or for sth. to happen, when it is likely to happen soon 准备好的；蓄势待发的
column3: e.g. The company is [[poised]] to launch its new advertising campaign.；e.g. Tina was tense, her hand [[poised]] over the telephone.

column2: 2) not moving, but ready to move or do sth. at any moment （摆好姿势）准备行动的
column3: e.g. The company is [[poised]] to launch its new advertising campaign.；e.g. Tina was tense, her hand [[poised]] over the telephone.

column2: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like sth. that is real or natural 人造的；人工的
column3: e.g. Energy is being wasted by using [[artificial]] lighting when daylight is adequate.

column2: [U] (abbr. AI) the study of how to make computers do intelligent things that people can do, such as think and make decisions 人工智能
column3: e.g. Language is crucial to the development of [[artificial intelligence]].

column2: [C] 无人机
column3: e.g. Above him an invisible plane [[droned]] through the night sky.

column2: make a continuous low dull sound 发出持续的嗡嗡声；嗡嗡作响
column3: e.g. Above him an invisible plane [[droned]] through the night sky.

column2: [C] sth. very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible 意外的幸运事；不可思议的事；奇迹
column3: e.g. The economic [[miracle]] of this country has always been a mystery.

column2: [U, sing.] sth. that encourages a process or activity to develop more quickly 刺激；推动（力）；促进
column3: e.g. The grant for building the opera house gave [[impetus]] to the city's cultural life.

column2: sb. / sth. that is unrecognizable has changed or been damaged so much that you do not recognize them （变得）不能识别的，认不出来的
column3: e.g. I hadn't been to the city for 20 years and it was almost [[unrecognizable]].

column2: 1) be very important or a powerful influence at a particular time 支配；盛行
column3: e.g. Silence [[reigned]] while we waited for news anxiously.；e.g. Queen Victoria [[reigned]] over Britain from 1837 to 1901.

column2: 2) rule a nation or group of nations as their king, queen, or emperor 为王；为君
column3: e.g. Silence [[reigned]] while we waited for news anxiously.；e.g. Queen Victoria [[reigned]] over Britain from 1837 to 1901.

column2: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence （权力、重要性或影响力）最高的，至高无上的
column3: e.g. Winning an Olympic gold medal was, I suppose, the [[supreme]] moment of my life.

column2: [C] a part of an area of activity, esp. of business, trade, etc.（尤指商业、贸易等领域的）部门，行业
column3: e.g. Data is continuously transforming the current landscape of many industries, including the financial [[sector]].

column2: [C] a small sign of sth. such as hope or understanding （希望等的）微弱迹象，一丝
column3: e.g. Despite an occasional [[glimmer]] of hope, this campaign has not produced any results.

column2: succeed in doing sth., esp. after trying very hard（尤指通过努力）完成，实现
column3: e.g. If we all work together, I think we can [[accomplish]] our goal.

column2: [C] sth. that is an impressive achievement, because it needs a lot of skill, strength, etc. to do 业绩；功绩；壮举
column3: e.g. The Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macao Bridge is a remarkable [[feat]] of engineering.

column2: completely change the appearance, form, or character of sb. / sth., esp. in a way that improves it 使改观；使变形；使转化
column3: e.g. The place was [[transformed]] from a quiet farming village into a busy port.；e.g. The trip to the cinema [[transforms]] into a full-day activity for the family.

column2: undergo a change in appearance, form, or character 改观；变形；转化
column3: e.g. The place was [[transformed]] from a quiet farming village into a busy port.；e.g. The trip to the cinema [[transforms]] into a full-day activity for the family.

column2: [U] the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful 动力；势头
column3: e.g. They are anxious to maintain the [[momentum]] of the search for a solution.

column2: following one after another in a series without interruption 连续的；不间断的
column3: e.g. After six [[consecutive]] defeats, the team was almost ready to give up.

column2: [C] the central and most important part of an area, system, activity, etc., which all the other parts are connected to （地域、系统、活动等的）中心，枢纽
column3: e.g. The city acts as the [[hub]] of the nation's railroads and highways.

column2: 1) suddenly or surprisingly quickly 突然；一下子
column3: e.g. He's realistic enough to know he's not going to succeed [[overnight]].；e.g. The temperature could fall below zero [[overnight]] in late autumn.

column2: 2) for or during the night 夜里；在夜间
column3: e.g. He's realistic enough to know he's not going to succeed [[overnight]].；e.g. The temperature could fall below zero [[overnight]] in late autumn.

column2: in a way that people admire or respect 令人钦佩地
column3: e.g. The team played [[impressively]] throughout the game.

column2: (fml.) grow or develop quickly 快速增长（发展）
column3: e.g. The company hoped to profit from the [[burgeoning]] market in artificial intelligence.

column2: [C] an important new discovery in sth. you are studying, esp. one made after trying for a long time 突破；重大进展
column3: e.g. Chinese scientists have made a major [[breakthrough]] in chip manufacturing.

column2: [U] the industry that designs and builds aircraft and space vehicles 航空航天工业；宇航工业
column3: e.g. Many companies are conducting ground-breaking research for the future of the [[aerospace]] industry.

column2: very great; felt or experienced very strongly 巨大的；重大的；深远的；深切的
column3: e.g. Over time, habits and routines have a [[profound]] effect on our quality of life.

column2: 1) develop and change gradually over a long period of time 逐步形成；逐渐演变
column3: e.g. Computer software will continue to [[evolve]] in response to users' needs.；e.g. More complex animals gradually [[evolved]] from these very simple creatures.

column2: 2) (of plants, animals, etc.) change gradually over a long period of time（植物、动物等）进化，进化形成
column3: e.g. Computer software will continue to [[evolve]] in response to users' needs.；e.g. More complex animals gradually [[evolved]] from these very simple creatures.

column2: imagine sth. that you think might happen in the future, esp. sth. that you think will be good 想象，展望（尤指美好的事）
column3: e.g. As a young teacher, I [[envisioned]] a future of educational excellence.

column2: [U, sing.] an opinion that everyone in a group agrees with or accepts 共同意见；一致看法；共识
column3: e.g. Could we reach a [[consensus]] on this matter? Let's take a vote.

column2: competing directly with another person or group 正面交锋地
column3: e.g. Rather than go [[head-to-head]] with their main rivals, they decided to try a more subtle approach.；e.g. He beat some of the world's greatest tennis players in [[head-to-head]] competition.

column2: (only before noun) in which two people or groups face each other directly in order to decide the result of a disagreement or competition 正面交锋的
column3: e.g. Rather than go [[head-to-head]] with their main rivals, they decided to try a more subtle approach.；e.g. He beat some of the world's greatest tennis players in [[head-to-head]] competition.

column2: [C] a position on a scale that shows how good sb. / sth. is when compared with others 排行；排名；名次
column3: e.g. Last year the tennis player rose from 39 to 35 in the world [[rankings]].

column2: [sing.] all the people who work in a particular industry or company, or are available to work in a particular country or area （行业的）全体从业人员；（公司的）全体员工；（国家或地区的）劳动力
column3: e.g. Senior executives are looking to build a highly skilled [[workforce]].

column2: (usu. before noun) showing determination; not giving up easily 顽强的；不屈不挠的；坚持不懈的
column3: e.g. Her ambition and [[dogged]] determination ensured that she rose to the top of her profession.

column2: completely full of 充满···的
column3: e.g. This website is packed with expert advice on how to manage time.

column2: at the present moment; for the time being 目前；暂时
column3: e.g. [[For now]], our plan will remain unchanged until something convinces us otherwise.

column2: if sb. / sth. reigns supreme, they are the most important part of a situation or time 主宰；称雄；呈极盛之势
column3: e.g. At that time, the bicycle [[reigned supreme]] as Britain's most popular mode of transportation.

column2: used to say what will happen or what happens generally over a long, short, or medium period of time 长期  中期
column3: e.g. In the long term, alcohol causes high blood pressure.

column2: (esp. spoken) used to say that you are not surprised by sth. 并不奇怪；不足为奇
column3: e.g. Under such circumstances, it is little wonder that they experience difficulties.

column2: [C, usu. pl.] a person who was born in the 1980s, 1990s, or early 2000s 千禧一代
column3: e.g. [[Millennials]] have grown up with the Internet and can't imagine a world without it.

column2: talk or think about pleasant events in your past 谈论， 追忆（快乐的往事）
column3: e.g. We sat side by side, [[reminiscing]] about the past.

column2: feeling sad because you do not want to do what you are doing 遗憾地；惋惜地
column3: e.g. I must [[regretfully]] decline your invitation.

column2: say sth., esp. about sth. you have just noticed 评论，谈到，说起（尤指刚察觉的事）
column3: e.g. Anderson left the table, [[remarking]] that he had some work to do.；e.g. He made a number of rude [[remarks]] about the food.

column2: sth. that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed 言论；意见；评论
column3: e.g. Anderson left the table, [[remarking]] that he had some work to do.；e.g. He made a number of rude [[remarks]] about the food.

column2: 1) a fact or an event in nature or society, esp. one that is not fully understood 现象
column3: e.g. Language is a social and cultural [[phenomenon]].；e.g. The rock band was a [[phenomenon]] — nobody had heard anything like them before.

column2: 2) sb. / sth. that is very unusual because of a rare quality or ability that they have 非凡的人（事物）；奇才；奇事
column3: e.g. Language is a social and cultural [[phenomenon]].；e.g. The rock band was a [[phenomenon]] — nobody had heard anything like them before.

column2: 1) a very large number of things produced at the same time 大量涌现；迸发
column3: e.g. Technology is offering us an [[outpouring]] of opportunities that will help us stay curious and creative.；e.g. The news of his death produced an instant [[outpouring]] of grief.

column2: 2) an uncontrolled expression of strong feelings （强烈感情的）流露，倾吐
column3: e.g. Technology is offering us an [[outpouring]] of opportunities that will help us stay curious and creative.；e.g. The news of his death produced an instant [[outpouring]] of grief.

column2: happening or done in a natural, often sudden way, without any planning or without being forced 自发的；自然而生的；一时冲动的
column3: e.g. The audience broke into [[spontaneous]] applause.

column2: [U] a feeling of great surprise 吃惊；惊奇
column3: e.g. Much to the [[amazement]] of her family, she left school to pursue her acting career.

column2: [C, U] a condition of life that causes difficulty or suffering 艰苦；贫困
column3: e.g. People suffered many [[hardships]] during that long winter.

column2: [C, usu. sing.] a reduction in economic, business, or other activity （经济、商业等活动的）下降，衰退
column3: e.g. There is evidence of a [[downturn]] in the housing market.

column2: (abbr. p.a.) (fml.) for each year 每年
column3: e.g. The country exports goods worth $600 million [[per annum]].

column2: (only before noun) only 唯一的
column3: e.g. The story was published with the [[sole]] purpose of selling newspapers.

column2: 1) sb.'s ability to do sth. 能力；才能
column3: e.g. They are worried about their [[capacity]] to invest for the future.；e.g. The newly-built theater has a seating [[capacity]] of 2,000.

column2: 2) the amount of space a container, room, etc. has to hold things or people 容量；容积；容纳人数
column3: e.g. They are worried about their [[capacity]] to invest for the future.；e.g. The newly-built theater has a seating [[capacity]] of 2,000.

column2: [C] a child or young person 孩童；年轻人
column3: e.g. These courses are specially designed for [[youngsters]] aged seven to nine.

column2: having a lot of experience of life, and good judgment about socially important things such as art and fashion. 见多识广的；老练的；练达的
column3: e.g. Mark is a smart and [[sophisticated]] young man.

column2: [C] the way in which a person or a group of people lives and works 生活方式
column3: e.g. Many people are trying to adopt a healthy [[lifestyle]] these days.

column2: 1) different from other people or things; doing things in your own way 特立独行的；独特的
column3: e.g. His music is highly [[individualistic]] and may not appeal to everyone.；e.g. A more [[individualistic]] society is also one with much more loneliness.

column2: 2) believing that what individual people want is more important than what society or the government wants 个人主义的
column3: e.g. His music is highly [[individualistic]] and may not appeal to everyone.；e.g. A more [[individualistic]] society is also one with much more loneliness.

column2: having the qualities that are needed to succeed as an entrepreneur 具有创业素质的
column3: e.g. The successful candidate will be an [[entrepreneurial]], goal-oriented problem solver.

column2: 1) sure that you have the ability to do things well or deal with situations successfully 有信心的；自信的
column3: e.g. I feel much more [[confident]] about myself and my abilities these days.；e.g. We are [[confident]] that next year's profits will be higher.

column2: 2) (not before noun) sure that sth. will happen in the way that you want or expect 确信的；有把握的
column3: e.g. I feel much more [[confident]] about myself and my abilities these days.；e.g. We are [[confident]] that next year's profits will be higher.

column2: fairly large, esp. large enough to have an effect or be important 相当大的（尤指能产生影响或很重要）
column3: e.g. [[Considerable]] progress has been made in finding a cure for the disease.

column2: frightening in a way that makes you feel less confident 使人气馁的；吓人的
column3: e.g. They were faced with the [[daunting]] task of restoring the house.

column2: 1) understand or deal with sth. difficult 理解，应付（困难复杂的情况）
column3: e.g. This outlook helped her [[navigate]] through her later years with success.；e.g. There weren't any road signs to help us [[navigate]] through the maze of one-way streets.

column2: 2) find which way you need to go while traveling from one place to another （为···）导航，指引方向
column3: e.g. This outlook helped her [[navigate]] through her later years with success.；e.g. There weren't any road signs to help us [[navigate]] through the maze of one-way streets.

column2: 1) believe or say that sb. / sth. has a particular quality 认为···具有···的特征
column3: e.g. People were beginning to [[attribute]] superhuman qualities to him.；e.g. The fall in the number of deaths from heart disease is generally [[attributed]] to improvements in diet.

column2: 2) believe or say that a situation or event is caused by sth. 把···归因于···
column3: e.g. People were beginning to [[attribute]] superhuman qualities to him.；e.g. The fall in the number of deaths from heart disease is generally [[attributed]] to improvements in diet.

column2: (infml.) knowing a lot about sth. and able to make good judgments about it 有见识的；在行的
column3: e.g. She bought the laptop on the advice of a computer-[[savvy]] friend.；e.g. He's obviously got a lot of political [[savvy]].

column2: [U] (infml.) practical knowledge and ability 实际知识和能力；见识
column3: e.g. She bought the laptop on the advice of a computer-[[savvy]] friend.；e.g. He's obviously got a lot of political [[savvy]].

column2: supporting new or modern ideas and methods, esp. in politics and education （尤指在政治和教育方面） 进步的，先进的
column3: e.g. We're looking for [[progressive]] ideas to move the company forward.

column2: (fml.) think of sth. in a particular way or as having a particular quality 认为；视为
column3: e.g. These buildings are [[deemed]] to be of architectural importance and must be protected.

column2: tending to think only about yourself and not thinking about the needs or feelings of other people 自我中心的；自私的
column3: e.g. She sounds totally [[self-centered]] and is showing you no consideration.

column2: feeling that you have the right to do or have what you want without having to work for it or deserve it, just because of who you are （由于自身身份）认为应得的，有权利的，有资格的
column3: e.g. I don't want to make my kids feel [[entitled]] only because I am a teacher at this school.

column2: 1) the act of buying and using products 购买；消费
column3: e.g. These products are not for national [[consumption]], but for export.；e.g. The government is determined to reduce the UK's total energy [[consumption]].

column2: 2) the amount of energy, oil, electricity, etc. that is used （能源、油、电等的）消耗量
column3: e.g. These products are not for national [[consumption]], but for export.；e.g. The government is determined to reduce the UK's total energy [[consumption]].

column2: (forecast, forecast; forecasted, forecasted) say what you expect to happen in the future 预测；预报
column3: e.g. They [[forecast]] a large drop in unemployment over the next two years.；e.g. The weather [[forecast]] said it was going to rain.

column2: [C] a statement of what is expected to happen in the future, esp. in relation to a particular event or situation 预测；预报
column3: e.g. They [[forecast]] a large drop in unemployment over the next two years.；e.g. The weather [[forecast]] said it was going to rain.

column2: [C, usu. pl., U] a strong desire to have or achieve sth. 强烈愿望；志向；抱负
column3: e.g. When I was 12, I had [[aspirations]] to play professional basketball.

column2: (fml.) in addition to what has already been said 此外；而且；不仅如此；更有甚者
column3: e.g. She always arrives on time; [[furthermore]], her work is always excellent.

column2: [U] (electronic commerce) the business of buying and selling of goods and services on the Internet 电子商务
column3: e.g. Travel companies have moved from the traditional bricks-and-mortar (实体的) environment to [[e-commerce]].

column2: influenced by the most fashionable styles and ideas 时髦的；受新潮思想影响的
column3: e.g. He writes for some [[trendy]] magazine.

column2: [C] a fashion, game, type of music, etc. that becomes very popular for a short time 时尚；一时的狂热
column3: e.g. If history is any guide, this latest diet for losing weight is just another [[craze]].

column2: apart from 除了···以外
column3: e.g. Are you studying any science subjects other than chemistry?

column2: used when you are comparing two things or people and saying that the second one is very different from the first 和···形成对照；相比之下
column3: e.g. The company lost $13 million this year, in contrast to a profit of $15 million last year.

column2: used for talking about the ways in which two things are different, or about the ways in which sth. has changed 相比于
column3: e.g. Unemployment in the region currently stands at 10.1 percent, as compared to a national average of 7.7 percent.

column2: (figuratively) resonate with; feel emotionally relevant to 与···产生共鸣；与···产生情感联结
column3: e.g. If this story [[spoke to]] you, I very much want to hear from you.
